node.statement: VIETA FORMULA: SUM OF ROOTS. The polynomial f(w) = (-nc) w^n + n w^{n-1} + (lower order terms) has n roots w_1, ..., w_n in C (counted with multiplicity). By Vieta formula for the sum of roots: w_1 + ... + w_n = -n/(-nc) = n/(nc) = 1/c. Since c in C^- (write c = a + bi with b < 0), we compute Im(1/c) = Im(conj(c)/|c|^2) = -b/|c|^2 > 0 (since b < 0). Therefore Im(w_1 + ... + w_n) = Im(1/c) > 0. This means the sum of imaginary parts of all roots is strictly positive: sum_{j=1}^n Im(w_j) > 0. In particular, at least one root has strictly positive imaginary part (lies in C^+).
